title: Investigating stem cell dynamics in stomach glands by computational models
impactText: A long-term collaboration with a highly recognized international team working at the forefront of stem cell biology has been established. Education,Healthcare,Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology Societal,Economic
findingsText:
Quantifying stem cells dynamics by integrating models and experiments under homeostasis allow us to understand the mechanism of regulation of the gut epithelium. 
There are 4-5 functional stem cells in the stomach that divide every 7 days. These stem cells are equipotent and their descendants can replace each other. The developed models and the fitted parameters inform on how stem cells work under homeostasis. Variation of these parameters may be indicators of illness.
Predictions on stem cell proliferation may be applied to estimate time for recovery after injuries or from side effects of some therapies. Education,Healthcare,Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology
